full_summary:
=================
**Government Tender Announcement: Enterprise Resource Planning Services**
=====================================================================================

### Solicitation Overview

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is soliciting proposals from qualified contractors to provide Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) services, specifically SuccessFactors release support services. This announcement pertains to the scope of work outlined in Stream 2 of the Supply Arrangement (SA).

### Tender Details

*   **Reference Number:** cb-384-64378176
*   **Amendment Number:** 1
*   **Solicitation Number:** 24-58067
*   **Publication Date:** June 24, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date:** July 16, 2024 at 14:00:00
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** September 2, 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** August 29, 2025

### Tender Overview

This tender is for the implementation partner to provide SuccessFactors release support services to the NRC's Human Resources Branch (HRB). Successful proponents will demonstrate expertise in ERP delivery, including but not limited to ERP implementation, customization, integration, and ongoing support.

### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation process will be selective, with the lowest compliant bid being chosen based on a combination of Technical Merit and Price. Proposals will be assessed on their ability to meet the requirements outlined in the tender document.

### Trade Agreements

This tender is subject to the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), and Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA).

### Contact Information

For more information on the solicitation, please refer to the attached tender documents. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact:

Philippe G. Cléroux
philippe.cleroux@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca
(343) 572-1109
